Qualified Business Income
Deduction (Section 199A
Deduction) To figure your Qualified Business Income Deduction, use Form 8995 or
Form 8995-A as applicable. Use Form 8995 if:
• You have qualified business income, qualified REIT dividends, or
qualified PTP income (loss);
• Your 2022 taxable income before
the qualified business income deduction
is less than or equal to $170,050
($340,100 if married filing jointly); and
• You aren’t a patron in a specified
agricultural or horticultural cooperative. If you don’t meet these requirements,
use Form 8995-A, Qualified Business
Income Deduction. Attach whichever
form you use (Form 8995 or 8995-A) to
your return. See the Instructions for
Forms 8995 and 8995-A for more information for figuring and reporting your
qualified business income deduction. Line 16
Tax

line 16 all of the following taxes that apply. • Tax on your taxable income. Figure the tax using one of the methods described later.
